pullRequest.body:
feat: an ideal, with the operations induced from its parent ring, forms a non-unital subring

Co-authored-by: Yakov Pechersky <pechersky@users.noreply.github.com>

---
This is my first PR, so please let me know if there are any improvements or adjustments needed to follow the project's conventions.

I think adding imports to add instances is a sign you need to put them in a new file.

Should I put these instances in a new file?

If so, what would be a good name for it and are there any similar "instance-only" files I can look at for reference?

I found these "instance-only" files:

```
Mathlib/Algebra/Category/Ring/Instances.lean
Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Hom/Instances.lean

Mathlib/Data/DList/Instances.lean

```

Would the appropriate file names for these instances be `Mathlib/RingTheory/Ideal/Instances.lean` and `Mathlib/RingTheory/TwoSidedIdeal/Instances.lean`?

I think you can put the `Ideal` stuff in `RingTheory.Ideal.Operations`, and for the `TwoSidedIdeal` just start a new file (maybe `RingTheory.Ideal.Instances` or something). It will likely get moved / absorbed in the near future as that API is developed.
Please let me know if there's anything more I can do. I believe I've addressed all the review comments.
